title: Shortbread Crust Recipe
description: Simple and easy shortbread crust you'll love. Especially wonderful if your planning to make a peach pie.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Desserts Pies Pie Crusts Pastry Crusts Shortbread Crust 4.6 (145) 126 Reviews 16 Photos Simple and easy shortbread crust you'll love. Especially wonderful if your planning to make a peach pie. Submitted by Silly Rabbit Updated on July 14, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 16 16 16 16 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 to 9 - inch pie crust Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 cup butter ½ cup confectioners' sugar 2 cups all-purpose flour ¼ teaspoon baking powder Directions Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl, cream butter and confectioners' sugar until light and fluffy. Stir together flour and baking powder; blend into butter mixture. Pat into a 9 inch pie plate. Bake in preheated oven for 12 to 15 minutes, or until edges are lightly browned. I Made It Print 216 home cooks made it! If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Shortbread Crust 01 of 16 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 16 Photo by  waterlady 07/19/2021 I doubled this super simple recipe to make a 9 x 13 crust for Key Lime Pie & it turned out beautifully, with enough left over to make a lg shortbread cookie. Yummy!! 03 of 16 Photo by  christelstar 12/12/2020 04 of 16 Photo by  PiccPlayer 06/29/2020 05 of 16 Photo by  Ramona 02/20/2020 I only wanted to make one 9 inch pie crust. So I just have to everything. I wish I would’ve read all the comments especially the one about refrigerating it a little while before baking. I did put that more than what I wanted and the edges didn’t stay up where I had them. All in all very good recipe and will make again with a few alterations at my own 06 of 16 Photo by  kathy wilson 09/05/2019 07 of 16 Photo by  lori 07/07/2019 08 of 16 Photo by  nrgizrbune41 10/20/2017 This was excellent! I make shortbread cookies & never requires baking powder so I didn't use any....This was excellent. I used this recipe in a 13 x 9" pan & no I DIDN'T double recipe. Look at thickness of crust! It would make 2 - 9" shells or the size you are seeing in photo. PS: the top was a recipe from this sight.... http://allrecipes.com/recipe/12241/lemon-pie-ii/ Both were excellent! 09 of 16 Photo by  FollowYourBliss 04/22/2017 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Shortbread Pie Crust 30 Ratings Vodka Pie Crust Dough Pate Brisee (French Shortcrust) 3 Ratings The Best Pastry Crust 3 Ratings Easy Homemade Pie Crust 504 Ratings Butter Flaky Pie Crust 2,195 Ratings Grandma's Secret Pie Crust 356 Ratings Rich Shortcrust Pastry 2 Ratings Jen's Killer Pie Crust Best Gluten-Free Pie Crust 15 Ratings Coconut Oil Pie Crust 5 Ratings Old Fashioned Flaky Pie Crust 43 Ratings Best Pie Crust 1,095 Ratings Basic Flaky Pie Crust 1,848 Ratings Lard Pie Crust 27 Ratings Buttery Crunch Crust 35 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Silly Rabbit
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;In a large bowl, cream butter and confectioners' sugar until light and fluffy. Stir together flour and baking powder; blend into butter mixture. Pat into a 9 inch pie plate.;Bake in preheated oven for 12 to 15 minutes, or until edges are lightly browned.
